data.enText: to put plants in the ground so that they have enough room to grow
data.chText: 均匀栽植（彼此保持适当距离以利生长）

tr: (botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
buildings for carrying on industrial labor
example: they built a large plant to manufacture automobiles

tr: something planted secretly for discovery by another
example: the police used a plant to trick the thieves
he claimed that the evidence against him was a plant

tr: an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience

example: Plant a thought in the students' minds

tr: place something or someone in a certain position in order to secretly observe or deceive
example: plant bugs in the dissident's apartment

tr: fix or set securely or deeply
example: He planted a knee in the back of his opponent
The dentist implanted a tooth in the gum

tr: put or set (seeds, seedlings, or plants) into the ground
example: Let's plant flowers in the garden

tr: set up or lay the groundwork for

data.enText: a living thing that grows in the earth and usually has a stem , leaves and roots, especially one that is smaller than a tree or bush
All plants need light and water.
data.chText: 一切植物都需要阳光和水。
开花 / 花园 / 室内植物

data.enText: the animal and plant life of the area
a factory or place where power is produced or an industrial process takes place
the large machinery that is used in industrial processes
The company has been investing in new plant and equipment.
data.chText: 这家公司一直在投资购置新机器和设备。

data.enText: something that sb has deliberately placed among another person's clothes or possessions in order to make them appear guilty of a crime
a person who joins a group of criminals or enemies in order to get and secretly report information about their activities
to put plants, seeds, etc. in the ground to grow
Plant these shrubs in full sun.
data.chText: 把这些灌木栽在阳光充足的地方。

data.enText: to cover or supply a garden/yard, area of land, etc. with plants
The field had been ploughed and planted with corn.
data.chText: 这块地已犁过并种上了玉米。

data.enText: to place sth or yourself firmly in a particular place or position
They planted a flag on the summit.
data.chText: 他们在山顶上插了一面旗子。

data.enText: He planted himself squarely in front of us.
data.chText: 他稳稳地站在我们面前。

data.enText: to hide sth such as a bomb in a place where it will not be found
to hide sth, especially sth illegal, in sb's clothing, possessions, etc. so that when it is found it will look as though they committed a crime
He claims that the drugs were planted on him.
data.chText: 他声称这些毒品是别人给他栽的赃。

data.enText: to send sb to join a group, etc., especially in order to make secret reports on its members
to make sb think or believe sth, especially without them realizing that you gave them the idea
He planted the first seeds of doubt in my mind.
data.chText: 是他最初启发我起疑心的。

data.enText: to put plants in the ground so that they have enough room to grow
data.chText: 均匀栽植（彼此保持适当距离以利生长）

data.text: factory ♦ plant ♦ mill ♦ works ♦ yard ♦ workshop ♦ foundry

data.enText: These are all words for buildings or places where things are made or where industrial processes take place.
data.chText: 以上各词均指工厂、车间、工场、制造厂。

data.enText: a building or group of buildings where goods are made

data.chText: 巧克力厂；香烟厂；制衣厂

data.enText: a factory or place where power is produced or an industrial process takes place
a factory that produces a particular type of material
data.chText: 指（生产特定材料的）工厂、制造厂：
棉纺厂；造纸厂；纺织厂；毛纺厂

data.enText: (often in compounds) a place where things are made or an industrial process takes place
data.chText: （常构成复合词）指工厂、制造厂：

data.enText: Raw materials were carried to the works by barge.
data.chText: 原材料由驳船运到工厂。

data.enText: (usually in compounds) an area of land used for building sth
data.chText: （通常构成复合词）指建造某物的区域、场地：

data.enText: a room or building in which things are made or repaired using tools or machinery
a factory where metal or glass is melted and made into different shapes or objects

ex.enText: Spring is the best season to plant trees.
ex.chText: 春天是最适合植树的季节。

ex.enText: Have you planted tomatoes in the garden?
ex.chText: 你在花园里种番茄了吗？

ex.enText: They grow food on their own plots of land.
ex.chText: 他们在自己的小块土地上种粮食。

ex.enText: Do you know how many tons of tomatoes America grows a year?
ex.chText: 你知道美国一年种植多少吨番茄吗？

synonyms.bx: 指种植植物或庄稼，强调播种或栽种完毕后的培育过程。

ex.enText: When do they usually sow the seeds?
Why do you sow these fields with oats?
ex.chText: 你们为什么在这些地里种燕麦？

ex.enText: My mother used to work in a clothing factory.
ex.chText: 我母亲以前在一家服装厂工作。

ex.enText: Mary works in a food factory.
ex.chText: 玛丽在一家食品厂工作。

synonyms.bx: 指使用机器设备大批量制造产品的工厂。

ex.enText: There is a textile mill round the corner.
The paper mill is run by a young man.
ex.chText: 这家造纸厂是由一个年轻人经营的。

synonyms.bx: 指生产棉纱、布匹、钢铁等材料的工厂。

ex.enText: There is a power plant nearby.
This college has a large manufacturing plant.
ex.chText: 这所大学有一个大型制造厂。

synonyms.bx: 指发电厂或进行工业生产的工厂。

ex.enText: There was an ironworks in the centre of the city before.
ex.chText: 过去在市中心有一家炼铁厂。

ex.enText: The brick works that bought this batch of equipment is located near the railway station.
ex.chText: 购进这批设备的砖厂位于火车站附近。

synonyms.bx: 泛指工厂，常和其他词构成复合词。

example.ex: Water each plant as often as required.
example.tran: 按要求经常给每一株植物浇水。

value.def: A plant is a living thing that grows in the earth and has a stem, leaves, and roots.

example.ex: He says he plans to plant fruit trees and vegetables.
example.tran: 他说他打算种植果树和蔬菜。

value.def: When you plant a seed, plant, or young tree, you put it into the ground so that it will grow there.

example.ex: Extensive flooding in the country has delayed planting and many crops are still under water.
example.tran: 这个国家大面积的水灾已延误了播种，而很多农作物还浸在水下。

example.ex: They plan to plant the area with grass and trees...
example.tran: 他们计划在这一地区种草植树。

example.ex: Recently much of their energy has gone into planting a large vegetable garden.
example.tran: 最近他们把很多精力投在种植大菜园上了。

value.def: When someone plants land with a particular type of plant or crop, they put plants, seeds, or young trees into the land to grow them there.

example.tran: 福特公司在英国的汽车装配厂

example.ex: The plant provides forty per cent of the country's electricity.
example.tran: 全国总电量的40%是这家发电厂提供的。

value.def: A plant is a factory or a place where power is produced.
Plant is large machinery that is used in industrial processes.
value.tran: 成套机械；成套设备；成套装置

example.ex: She planted her feet wide and bent her knees slightly.
example.tran: 她双脚宽分站稳，膝盖微屈。

example.ex: ...with his enormous feet  planted heavily apart.
example.tran: 他的大脚重重地分开站好

value.def: If you plant something somewhere, you put it there firmly.

example.ex: So far no one has admitted planting the bomb.
example.tran: 到目前为止，还没有人承认是自己放了炸弹。

value.def: To plant something such as a bomb means to hide it somewhere so that it explodes or works there.

example.ex: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
example.tran: 他声称毒品是有人栽赃陷害他。

value.def: If something such as a weapon or drugs is planted on someone, it is put among their possessions or in their house so that they will be wrongly accused of a crime.
value.tran: 把（武器、毒品等）栽赃（于某人）

example.ex: Journalists informed police who planted an undercover detective to trap Smith.
example.tran: 记者通知了警方，后者于是为诱捕史密斯而安插了一名卧底侦探。

value.def: If an organization plants someone somewhere, they send that person there so that they can get information or watch someone secretly.

example.ex: She planted a kiss on each of his leathery cheeks.
example.tran: 她在他粗糙的面颊上左右各吻了一下。

value.def: If you plant a kiss on someone, you give them a kiss.

example.ex: He hoped that he could plant the idea in such a way that Abramov would believe it was his own.
example.tran: 他希望能把这个想法注入阿布拉莫夫的头脑，但要让他相信这是他自己的念头。

value.def: If you plant an idea in someone's mind, they begin to accept the idea without realizing that it has originally come from you and not from them.

trans: 安家落户；安顿自己；站立不动；找到职位安顿下来；处于固定位置
发电厂；同 power station；发电站
于当地设生产厂房；生产设备；生产工厂；生产厂
化工廠；化工厂；家化工厂；化工装置；化工设备
核電廠；核电站；核电厂；核动力装置；核能发电厂
火电厂；热电厂；动力装置；热力发电厂；火力发电厂
加工厂；处理厂；石油加工厂；处理工厂；开放加工厂系统
